intro: Claoxylon insulanum, commonly known as the island satinwood, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It is often found in coastal and lowland forests, thriving in humid and warm climates. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation projects.
